title: 92/148/EEC: Commission Decision of 21 February 1992 approving an amendment to the varietal conversion programme for hops submitted by the Kingdom of Spain pursuant to Council Regulation (EEC) No 2997/97 (Only the Spanish text is authentic)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION  of 21 February 1992  approving an amendment to the varietal conversion programme for hops submitted by the Kingdom of Spain pursuant to Council Regulation (EEC) No 2997/97  (Only the Spanish text is authentic)  (92/148/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The amendment to the varietal conversion programme for hops, submitted pursuant to Regulation (EEC) No 2997/87 by the Kingdom of Spain on 18 December 1991, is hereby approved. The main aspects of the programme as amended are given in the  Annex hereto.
The Kingdom of Spain shall inform the Commission every six months of progress in the programme.
This Decision is addressed to the Kingdom of Spain.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 21 February 1992. For the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ No L 284, 7. 10. 1987, p. 19. (2) OJ No L 367, 29. 12. 1990, p. 2. (3) OJ No L 365, 24. 12. 1987, p. 41. (4) OJ No L 41, 14. 2. 1991, p. 18. (5) OJ No L 234, 11. 8. 1989, p. 50.
ANNEX
1. List of producer groups covered by the programme:
- Grupo de cultivadores de liupulo de Garrizo de la Ribera, Asociacion de Productores Agrarios, APA no 1,
- Agrupacion Comercial de Campesinos Leoneses 'ACCAL' de Astorga, Asociacion de Productores Agrarios, APA no 2.
2. Duration of programme
From 1988 to 1994. The last plantings must be carried out before 31 December 1994.
3. Areas covered by the programme
617 hectares
4. Varieties to be planted and areas concerned
Aromatic varieties
Spalt
Hersbrucker
Fino Alsacia
Hallertau  maximum of 5 % of areas converted (at most 30,85 hectares)
Super-alpha varieties (1)
Specific clones
of the variety H 3  minimum of 95 % of areas converted (at least 586,15 hectares)
(1) Within the meaning of Article 2 of Regulation (EEC) No 2997/87 and Article 1 (3) of Regulation 3889/87.
